sentences.english: The King of Lu led the army by himself.
sentences.chinese: 鲁国由鲁王亲自带兵迎战。

sentences.english: The former soldiers into the operation room, but could not see the Wuchang.
sentences.chinese: 前原带兵进入到手术室却不见那五常的踪影。

sentences.english: One day Jiang Wei led his soldiers to seize army provisions. The soldiers of the Shu State took advantage of this and seized the city.
sentences.chinese: 一日带兵劫粮，蜀兵乘虚取冀城。

sentences.english: See ChunYu male goes out and come, all the young very nervous immediately defense.
sentences.chinese: 见淳于雄带兵而至，众少年非常紧张立即防御。

sentences.english: Commanders are required to lead troops and have leadership.
sentences.chinese: 指挥员必须会带兵，有领导指挥能力。

sentences.english: Thus excelling at generalship is merely a question of exercising love and awesomeness.
sentences.chinese: 所以善于带兵的人，就要善于掌握爱与威的运用。

sentences.english: This time, lead the Yellow Emperor, to lead troops reached the Chiyou array.
sentences.chinese: 这次，黄帝身先士卒，带兵杀入蚩尤阵中。

sentences.english: Zhuge Liang sent captured-general Xiahou Mao to Jicheng City to persuade Jiang Wei to surrender.
sentences.chinese: 诸葛亮又派俘将夏侯杼木带兵前往冀城劝姜维投降。

sentences.english: Objective To study the personality of primary officials in a certain military ministry.
sentences.chinese: 目的从总体上把握基层带兵干部的人格特征。

sentences.english: ZhangJi goes out to, the clouds deep pretend to Mrs Lu do hostages, run out.
sentences.chinese: 张吉带兵赶来，云深假装以吕夫人做人质，逃了出去。

definition: to put down a revolt/to pacify a rebellion
to go on a punitive expedition
to dispatch an army/to send troops
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
to serve the king diligently/to save the country in times of danger/to send troops to rescue the king
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
to send armed forces to suppress
